meanings.definition: Serving as an introduction or prelude.
meanings.sent1: The prelusive music set the mood for the play.
meanings.sent2: Her prelusive speech hinted at what was to come.
meanings.sent3: The prelusive dance of the fireflies entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: The prelusive sunrise painted the sky with hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The prelusive aroma of fresh bread filled the kitchen, signaling breakfast.

meanings.sent1: The prelusive signs of spring brought hope to the town.
meanings.sent2: His prelusive actions foreshadowed a major change.
meanings.sent3: The prelusive chirping of the birds woke her up with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The prelusive raindrops tapped gently on the window, announcing the storm.
meanings.sent5: The prelusive crack of thunder echoed through the valley, heralding the storm's arrival.
